Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 4theluvoflife
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marmara is very well located and within walking distance to shops, restaurants and cafes. The rooms are nice but on the small side with great views of the Bosphorus River. The bathroom is nice and has speakers so you can hear your tv while taking a shower. The fridge is very well stocked and you even get red bull. We got upgraded with access to the clubroom where at any time; you can have desserts, hors d'oeuvres wine and tea while looking at the amazing 360-degree views where the black sea and the Sea of Marmara flow in to each other. Room service had amazing food!! The police heavily guard the hotel entrance, and you have a metal detector to get through. The lobby is very nice and while you sit, the waiters get you this special tea and I loved the way they served it. Hotel staff were very nice and helpful with tips on where to go. Traveled Summer 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwiwineman
Reviews.Content: Top location BUT rooms facing Taksim are noisy and Turks like to stay up late, so take ear plugs or ask for rear facing room

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: anil_talasli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at the heart of Ä°stanbul.The rooms are well-equiped and clean. I highly recommend the rooms with bosphorous view. The breakfast service is good but was better before.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the business visitor and those who MUST have the perfect view”
Reviews.Author: Anthony-Susan
Reviews.Content: Location, view, food...this hotel is one I have stayed at frequently during the past year. As a business visitor, it has everything I want and need, including an ideal location, well appointed rooms, a good business center and fitness facility, and stunning views of the Bosporus and the Golden Horn, excellent restaurants and superb executive floor lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A very satifying experience overall.”
Reviews.Author: emrerendedotkom
Reviews.Content: First of all the obvious. Location location location. I am Turkish, lived in Istanbul for many years and it is arguably unbeatable. In the middle Istanbul's (largest) Taksim square, across the street from the metro station, walking distance to Istanbul's main shopping artery and the Bosphorus. The hotel had been in need of a facelift for many years and this has been done 6 months ago. The result is very good. The lobby's new design is very chic and inviting. The breakfast is absolutely fantastic. While on the subject of food, the super-hip Istanbul eatery chain Kitchenette operates almost as part of the hotel and is a great place for people watching. However if there is one thing that this hotel has that any other hotel is Istanbul doesn't... it's the mind boggling view from its sea-view rooms. I could from my window see the Bosphorus, the Haghia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Galata Tower and the Golden Horn. Literally breathtaking. The only thing i will complain about is the furniture in the rooms. I think they should be next in the face-lifting process.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Istanbul ever!”
Reviews.Author: Janulik69
Reviews.Content: Marmara Taksim is such a lovely hotel! We booked flying carpet grand suite with view to Bosporus and Old town, an I have to say WAU! Really great experience !!! Anyway, room is not only one great thing in this hotel! Hotel staff is simply amazing, so kind and helpful! Unfortunately, I don't remember name of my favorite reception man ;-) I would definitely recommend him! He managed A great day trip with guide for us! It cost 350 euro but service was excellent! And recommend nice restaurant for us as well! And everything perfect again! I travel a lot, but this hotel is really TOP for me! Great location, next to many nice shops, few minutes by taxi to Old town! Thank u Marmara Taksim! U made My holiday special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well established and maintained hotel with room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: real_nemo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a well established hotel in Istanbul at a good and central location. Service and food are excellent. Some rooms (especially on the upper levels) have nice views. I was a little disappointed that the cleaning of the rooms usually took until after! lunch at that many people needed to access the room throughout the afternoon. It would be nice to have housekeeping sometime in the morning and then it is done for the day. A big backdraw was the water temperature of the shower. It kept varying by itself (which happens in many hotels) but it changed from rather cold to boiling!!!! hot. So hot that it was impossible to stand! The walls are thin, so be aware, you can hear your neighbor snorring, ....

Reviews.Title: “great for tourists and business travellers”
Reviews.Author: frozenapple
Reviews.Content: Practically the best location to go sightseeing in Istanbul! If you are a business traveller, it will also give you that 2 hours you need after a hardworking day to see around a bit. Loved the room, the gym overlooking the square and the staff. Breakfast was OK and they even prepared nice breakfast boxes for us as we were leaving before the breakfast serving time. We had some problems, too, though. 1. After checking-out early - as I needed to leave quite early the next day - I went to my room and my door was wide open and there was a man inside. It turned out that although I told the receptionist that I was going to stay the night after my check-out, they still sent a guy to my room to check the minibar! 2. I was with a foreign mission in Istanbul and the members of the mission had to change rooms at midnight because of some strange smoke coming out of the air conditioner! They said it really smelled like there was a fire somewhere. 3. The price is just too high for my taste and I wouldn't prefer this hotel on any ground whatsoever (I find spending too much on a comfy bed a bit extravagant) if it was me who had to pay for it. Thankfully, I was on duty and everything was covered by the organizing project.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Aldafri
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel really the best location best views so many near buy Resturant so many activities and the metro is gust across the street you can go every where from the hotel without A taxi so you can safe a lot of mouny

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: MarijaM043
Reviews.Content: We visited the Marmara Taksim Hotel and I must say, when I first entered I was amazed by the interior design, but on second look you can see that the hotel is not as new as it appears. The room was very comfortable and welcoming and I was surprised how comfortable was the bed. What I didn't liked was the bathroom. The quality of the water was very bad and the toilet didn't worked well as well as the shower. The restaurant and the food were amazing and the cook was the most friendly person of all the employees there, the waiters were acting like they can't wait to get rid of you. All in all my impresions are positive, the most joyfull and polite employees were the cook and the maid that cleaned our room. The rest of the employees were not very welcoming. Considering the fact it is quite expensive hotel, i belive the management should pay more attention to their guest and at least be polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: YeÅŸim C
Reviews.Content: I think the Marmara is one of the best hotel in Turkey , i visited with my husband for Valentines day and had a super romantic day & night . The meals are "delicious" ,service is really nice . I also love the decoration of the hotel and room . I want to visit as soon as possible :)

Reviews.Title: “Very good business option”
Reviews.Author: 17JAC17
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul on business about 3 times a year. I have stayed at a variety of places. This time, I got a good rate at the Marmara Taksim, so I gave it a try. I was very pleased with the hotel. The location is excellent - right on Taksim Square so you can get to various parts of town and it is across the street from the subway. The room was a bit dated, but comfortable, with wonderful views. The true selling point was the staff: by far the friendliest and most helpful I have ever seen in Istanbul. And in a place where customer service is friendly, that is saying a lot. Everyone at this hotel was wonderful. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel adn fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: RicardoReeves
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very close of subway, cafÃ©, restaurants, stores, galata tower, Taksim square....

Reviews.Title: “Sooooo Expensive,”
Reviews.Author: elilance
Reviews.Content: Breakfast 60 lira , Hair cut 45 lira Shoe Shine 25 Lira , Perfect place for rip off the tourist. Stayed total of 9 nights and not happy at all.Never ever go back again .

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Taksim Square”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: It's a good hotel, to me it's a good 4* though, not 5. It was clean. Room was big for standard category. The conciege staff was very helpful. The bed was not very comfortable. I would give it 3*. Bath tub was a bit old, the drain had problems. The hotel's location was not an advantage. not sure if there's a police starion or a hospital in the area, but we couldn't sleep from the constant siren and that was a real issue when we returned to the hotel tired and in need of good rest. I won't stay at this hotel again. good rest is important for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Carolinde
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Taksim Square is very central. Underground station and hop on-hop off sightseeing tour right in front of the hotel. Room was a good size with all the facilities, like a good bed and minibar. Breakfast was good, lots of choice! Very nice and helpful, friendly staff at reception, concierge, business centre (where you can check your mail for free). About 4-5 minutes' walk to the airport bus. Would certainly stay here again. I asked for a room on one of the top floors, which I got. Traffic is very busy, even at night, in Taksim Square, so can be very noisy. So make sure you ask for a room on one of the top floors.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aysegulbarber
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time in this hotel... The room was spacious.. fantastic view.. They let me to stay until 2.30pm for free of charge the final day!.....excellent service...I will go and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Two Nights In Marmara.”
Reviews.Author: Houshang K
Reviews.Content: It was really nice when I came in the hotel for first time and soon I found that this hotel is my best choice . The reception staff was a nice man that I have never forget him. The room "Bosphore view" in 14th floor was really nice that I have never seen up to that time.The 4 de luxe design elevators with very fast speed are also one of the another positive items which should be considered to evaluate of this hotel. The staff were very kind, polite and helpful . The Tuti Resturant "for breakfast " was very large area with friendly condition , various edible items and good view to Taksim square.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Mette L
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for the rooms two months before arrival. No problems with check -in and the staff was very friendly all the way. Try the hotel's haman - nice and warm experience when it's cold outside. The location is good- in the Taksim square. To far to walk to Sulthanamet, but taxis are everywhere and the hotel gives you an estimated price for your journey if you ask

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sheldoner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best i ve stayed at in Istanbul, mostly cuz it s perfectly located and the service is better than at all other mainstream 5 star hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: At first when you walk in you think you are in Vegas. The lobby is very modern is always bustling with activity. The staff were very helpful and nice. The upstairs bar is a great place to get drinks because of the amazing views of the city. The rooms were adequate, they weren't huge. Not sure I would consider it a 5 star hotel but it was nice. The only issue I had was the amount of smoke that was in our hallway. The rooms are listed as no smoking but I could smell smoke in our hallway and it eventually seeped into our room as well. All in all, great location with a lot going on around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not 5 star -- an average 4 at best.”
Reviews.Author: allwaysonthego
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has to offer is it's location, but there are lots of equaly well placed hotles in the area. i have stayed here 3 times. for the prices it is poor value, The rooms are dated and very small for 5 star. forget trying to work at the desk and sideboard in the room.. it is cramped and uncomfortable, I could barely fit my legs under the table and i am slim. The breakfast is excellent .. no quibbles there and the staff polite.. especially the porters. Overall though it is not a 5 star hotel in service and general room size. If you are coming from a place where you are not used to noise at night don't stay here. Taxim square below never stops with horns and sirens all night. Also the room to room sound insulation is very poor and you can hear hairdryers and coughing in some rooms. What really annoyed me was the stopper in the sink did not hold the hot water for shaving. Although the bathroom overall was fine the shower temperature tended to change randomly obviously due to poor design of pipework. I'm looking for other places on my next trip .

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, no problems”
Reviews.Author: walkabout101
Reviews.Content: I liked the location, was a bit busy area, but room was quiet. Room service was among the fastest I'd ever had. Room was a decent size, bathroom on the bigger side. Decor and condition were ok. Bed and pillow were comfy enough for me, and I'm quite picky in that regard. No problems sleeping. Shower had a sulphur smell a couple times. Front desk and concierge staff were good. The included breakfast was decent, enough choice there for me. Did not eat there other than the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Kaiukas
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately it was not a nice experience at all, quite the opposite. For a 5 star hotel, the decor is dated, rooms look tired and actually quite ugly, but where the hotel really 'excelled' in was its appalling service. The attempts to demonstrate hospitality were clumsy and intrusive. For example, I went to bed quite early each night because I was a bit poorly and every night I was woken up by a member of staff who delivered two very nicely packed complimentary dried apricotes. Why? The rest of the service was very much along the same lines. The reception staff was either genuinely extremely incompetent or they were taking a mickey on us stupid foreigners by doing a good 'Fawlty Towers' sketch :) To be fair, there was one positive (apart from absolutely excellent location): the breakfast was brilliant, haven't had such lovely breakfast in a hotel for quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “good location only”
Reviews.Author: shathra
Reviews.Content: i made an online reservation on their official site and the room rates were fixed but they changed the rate of the first day for reasons i did not understand , it has a good location only

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a 5* experience!”
Reviews.Author: TuncY
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in a Golden Horn view room. After entering the hotel, no porter was present at the door. We had to carry our luggage up ourselves. The room was quite ugly (bad decoration, worn out carpet) and the bathroom small compared to similar hotels. Of course, location is excellent. As for breakfast, didnt try! There is a Cafe called "Kitchenette" located at the side of the hotel and its a good idea to eat there as they have all sorts of tasty omelettes, sandwiches and waffles/crepes. Overall, this isn't a 5* experience. Especially not a 5* room!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: GokhanOzkan
Reviews.Content: I know this hotel for a very long time. It is one of the 4 first 5 star hotels in Istanbul. Recently we organized a big company event with almost 400 people from all around the world. The service, food, staff, conference rooms are exceptional. The view from the Roof restaurant and seaside room is spectacular. Although its one of the oldest 5 stars in the city, recently made renovation changed its old fashioned lobby and reception area look into a super modern upto date look. THe only hick upfor our group was the difficulty in moving 400 people between different floors for break up meetings due to being limited only to elevators. Still the staff is very helpful and resourceful doing their best to solve any problem. i hope the next renovation is done at the rooms division. The rooms are obviously are getting old.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, nice rooms, friendly service and good food”
Reviews.Author: Alina S
Reviews.Content: The hotel has really great location; the metro is only 2 minutes from the hotel, the Istiklal Street only 2 minutes from the hotel. There are a lot of cafes around the hotel. The service in the Hotel is very friendly, rooms are clean, comfortable and cosy. If you need non-smoking room â€“ you just need to tell this to the reception upon your check in. The breakfast is very nice but this is not 5-star hotel breakfast. The is Free Wi Fi internet in the rooms. The luggage delivery is very poor as we had to wait 30 minutes to get our suitcases but we needed our luggage very urgently and we were calling to the front desk 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a 5-star”
Reviews.Author: Arghi A
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be better and the staff were helpful. However, the hotel is old and the breakfast was typical,not like a 5-star hotel. Another problem was related to the noise of the other rooms and it made us to wake up at 06:00 AM everyday!!! Apart from noise the room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: PJayGosfordNSW
Reviews.Content: This a nice hotel in agreat location,very close to trains/buses, but it is not 5 star. 4 may be.The staff are not interested in providing service. They look straight through you. At breakfast you have to hunt down & ask a waiter 2/3 times for coffee. Front desk staff are all good, no problems there. My room on 11th floor was tiny, Free Wi Fi which was great. Rooms dont have irons, you have to ask room service to send one , they must have 2 for the whole hotel because it toook many phone calls to get one. In the end i had to say that it was urgent, so they sent one up some from house keeping & they pressed what i needed without charge.The gym & the pool are terrific, the breakfast buffet is very good. The bar on the roof is also really great. It is very dark so you can see the night views, great place to relax. The biggest problem is ther size of the rooms & the absent service that lets them down

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Frenes5
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice rooms friendly service and good food. They brand the hotel as a 5-stars but the service is nowhere near that level. Waiting time at front desk, for concierge advises, or for luggage delivery (I had to wait 30 minutes to get my suitcase brought up despite 3 calls to the front desk. It was mid day and I needed my suit to go to a meeting), over-crowded breakfast room make me consider it more as a good big 4 starts hotel. So don't pay 5-star prices and you won't be disappointed :-) Special mention for the internet service. It was included in my fare, itâ€™s a simple wifi code that you can use both on your laptop and smart phone and it works well everywhere in the hotel. I wish all hotels could offer this!!! One more thing: the price of a red bull from the mini-bar is 16 TL (6.5â‚¬ which is outrageous for Istanbul).

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: Felemban
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by the location of this hotel and the nearby shops, restaurants and coffee shops ... Imagine yourself returning tired from a trip through the metro and finding your hotel in front of you when you get off the station ... The other amazing thing is the breakfast buffet ...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, expecting better”
Reviews.Author: Mohammad K
Reviews.Content: The service is very good but the hotel itself is too old. The room rate was very high compare to other hotels in the area and I was expecting to see a five star hotel but our room was at 3 star level. The furniture were old, hair drier was broken, we have to open and close the room door by force. I expected much better for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Oasis”
Reviews.Author: mstephens7
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Istanbul. This hotel was recommended and I am glad I went with it. I upgraded to a club room and had free breakfast and evening snacks/drinks everyday. The hotel was quiet and calming except for the lobby which had a bustling, exciting feel. Great location to tour the city and easy access to public transport. Very helpful and friendly staff - especially for this American traveling so far from home.

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism”
Reviews.Author: DaphnePillai
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Taksim has a great location in Istanbul. One has the view of an ancient civilisation throbbing with new life along the Bosphorus river. We attended a conference called 'India Calling" and were very impressed with the professionaism displayed by the hotel authorities. We were a big group, but they processed our check-in with ease and we were given our alloted rooms without a long wait. The other highlight of this hotel was the shoe-shine man at the lobby. It was such a novel experience to sit and get one's shoes polished.

Reviews.Title: “Taksim is a great Happening plance and hotel is in the Middle”
Reviews.Author: SAKader
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to the Bhosphoros sea view Room and it was a totally differnt experience. I loved every moment in my room. The only issue was that the Toilet was little small and also the tub was really tiny. Has a few good restaurants and Bars. Taksim is the most happening Place and the Hotel is also at the middle of Taksim. Very well connected to subway train.

Reviews.Title: “the location out standing”
Reviews.Author: Ramzan_Alnaimi
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very good , I stayed there for 1 night , the room was (small and tiny but clean and looks New) the location of the hotel wad very good as it's in the heart of Takseem square which get all cafe's and resturands and shops . the food was good , only one thing I like to add as it's fir mr a major thing : the reciptionest should smile some time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great view and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: TheGoodMan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and the hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive hotel”
Reviews.Author: baldinik
Reviews.Content: Top hotel in Istanbul. Excellent wiew, large room, good service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: PGNic
Reviews.Content: This is a real 5* hotel in the heart of Taxsim Square with Istiklal Street just around the corner - so it is very convenient for lots of local attractions, shopping etc. The hotel has lots to offer - from fine dining (the panoramic restaurant must have the best views of Istannbul in the whole city) and the swimming pool and sunbathing area offering fantasctic views across the Bosphorus. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are extremely clean and tidy with free wi-fi provided in all rooms. Overall a very nice experience and a hotel which we are sure to return to on our next visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient View! Good Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: AkshayGN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days in February 2011. At that time , large portions of the hotel were undergoing renovation. They had however managed to keep it rather neat and clean in spite of the construction. Our room was on the 18th floor and it was a warm medium sized room with the regular amenities you would expect from a 5* hotel. Very tastefully done. The air conditioning was a bit too strong but the regulator took care of that. The most breath-taking part of the room was the SPECTACULAR view from the window. It overlooked the heart of Istanbul on one side, stretching across to the Bosphorus and the gorgeous Sultanhamet district on the other side. The view alone, made this trip worth it! Breakfast was standard, although there seemed to be a conference going on at the same time so breakfast was a noisy affair with all conference delegates barging in. The health club looked clean but old - especially the jacuzzi, the steam and sauna. Further more, the health club is also open to people who are not staying at the hotel; so evenings get a bit crowded. Stay here, by all means, but only to enjoy the view and to spend comfortable nights. Istanbul, I am sure will give you enough reasons to get out of your hotel room during the day time!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: bulamatari
Reviews.Content: if you like to see ships from far above this is the place had both views first bosphorus and then golden horn almost did not want to leave the room.

Reviews.Title: “City Center Location - great views, comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: avisbee
Reviews.Content: Marmara at taksim was recomended by the family, and it lived upto it. Very well located with great views of the city. While checking in or booking, ask for Bosphorous view rooms - its brilliant. The swimming pool has great views, but a bit small. The roof top resturant is a bit expensive but worth the price for its amazing view of Istanbul city

Reviews.Title: “Grrrrrrrreat stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnnysfriend
Reviews.Content: We had a room on top floor, the honeymoon one! Best view I've ever seen (Bosphorus)... Love the lobby, The panaroma restaurant and the bar. Liked the design allllot ... the only thing that wasn't as good as the old city was the location. SO CROWDED!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: principessa_m
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and nice, although a bit old. staff very friendly and helpful, spoke english, italian and german. the building is quite tall so it has nice views from the windows. you cannot be more central than that: its in the middle of main square.

Reviews.Title: “superb bosphorus view”
Reviews.Author: adytrip
Reviews.Content: very convenient place,very polite and hospitable staff superb view of bosphorus from club room protean breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: I have been several time in this hotel both for business and turism. The hotel is not new but the quality is still high. The location is just in the center of Istanbul and to go to historical part you can use the metro or do a long but nice walk in the city. The shopping area is very close. The room are nice and many of them are with a great view of the the sea. The breakfast is very rich, the service is good and the staff very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly NOT A 5 Stars Hotel "class less"”
Reviews.Author: dr4kids03
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many countries and for the most part almost always have stayed in a five star hotelâ€¦ This is in no way a 5 star hotel but a 4 at best.. Now the location is phenomenal and may be thatâ€™s why they get a 5 star rating.. So please be aware that in terms of the hotel appearance and services itâ€™s a 4. Staff hit and miss, some are very pleasant and helpful others are extremely rude. I asked the concierge a simple question; he goes on the phone and startsâ€™ talking to someone for a lengthy time then walks away without acknowledging my presence in front of him or answering my question. Here is another inside of how â€œclassyâ€� or â€œhospitableâ€� this place is during check out I paid my full bill which is let just say in the thousands (US dollars) after the transaction and all paid the young lady say â€œoh you took a bottle of water please pay me 5 Turkish lira (about 2 US dollars) and I actually had to pay thatâ€¦. Imagine after staying that long and paying that much canâ€™t even offer a bottle of water. Also if you have kids I strongly discourage this hotel.. Itâ€™s not Kids friendly (less than 13) In the pool area they do not expect kids to talk or laugh or play in the pool but to be â€œquiteâ€� and my kids are 4,6 (girls) very quite and pleasant girls but yes they laugh and play in the poolâ€¦Rooms are Extremely, extremely small and you can hear the noise from next door and outside also you might have to ask everyday to have your room cleanedâ€¦ Overall I do not recommend this place at allâ€¦..

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, Taksim square noisy but able to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Chingachgook
Reviews.Content: The facility has a great location on Taksim square. This is however a busy part of town and the demonstrations in Istanbul usually are on Taksim. We enjoyed the facility very much. The noise outside, more from demonstrators than the construction at the hotel was a somewhat downer but the election is over now. We would definitely return to this hotel were we to return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better for the money ...”
Reviews.Author: waysidemen
Reviews.Content: Back again after a two year gap (it seems like yesterday but having turned 60, life is galloping past at two months a week ...) and little has changed here. We missed the new lobby, bar and breakfast lounge by a week but the plus side was that breakfast was being served in the Panorama Restaurant on the 19th floor and the views made up for the somewhat limited choice (the egg department was trying to do omlettes and fried eggs on the equivalent of a gas-fired Baby Belling - hopeless!) and slow service. I had a room on the 11th floor angled away from Taksim so the outside noise wasn't too bad but as before, inside noise was bad; slamming doors and noisy maid-service was irritating and unnecessary. I had no problems with the reception staff who were cheerful and helpful but I did discover ( by overhearing) that the nightly rate was E400 ... I hope that was with breakfast!! Beds, pillows and linen are of the very highest quality but I do question the need to change the last of these every day; surely wasteful and very un-green? Of course, the position cannot be bettered and if you can afford it, it's an averagely good hotel but some issues (like the non-replacement of teabags and glasses - I mentioned this two years ago) need to be addressed....

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: carolyngva
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Marmara Taksim. The service provided by the employees is wonderful and the hotel is perfectly located in the city centre. The view from the restaurant is really nice, when having our breakfast. We would appreciate a more design and modern decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutchman42
Reviews.Content: The Marama Taksim is a modern, well-run hotel just off Taksim Square in a lively and convenient part of Istanbul. It is a couple of rather hilly miles from the famous sites of the Old City, but these are pretty accessible via public transportation (which is a little tricky to navigate, but well worth figuring out). Rooms on the back of the hotel (facing the Bosporus) are very quiet, those toward the square a little less so. Taksim Square can be a bit of a scene a night, and there can be plenty of traffic even at midnight. The hotel sits on a hill, so the views even from the lower floors are good. Those from the restaurant on the top floor are spectacular. The staff is very professional and friendly, the WiFi works well, and the business center is open 24 hours. All the beds have just been replaced, and they are very comfortable. The only peculiarity I noticed is that the complimentary toiletries don't include hair conditioner -- first time I've seen that.

Reviews.Title: “5 star raises expectations too high - but overall it is good”
Reviews.Author: NoNameHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: As others have mentioned it is in an excellent central position. The entrance is a mess at the moment whilst they are undergoing major building works, but this looks likely to be finished soon. Nothing wrong with the hotel and the staff were very friendly, but we would say it is more 4 star than 5 star. 5 star raises expectations much higher. The good points:- Excellent Position Friendly staff Fine views from many rooms Modern rooms The so so points *some of these may be minor, but it is advertised as a 5 star hotel . The bedrooms are not very large The bathrooms have a small bath with a shower in it. I would have expected a separate shower cucbicle as well as a bath for a 5 star hotel The top floor bar / restaurant does not have an outside area (their sister hotel, the 4 star Marmara Pera downtown has a fantastic roof top bar and small pool) It does however have fantastic views. The drink prices in the rooms are far too expensive, they should bring them down and they would make far more sales. Over Â£5 for a small coca cola ? The pool is not heated, I only saw one person in it. For a one off price of about Â£5000 and Â£4000 yearly electricity costs they could heat this pool to about 25C to 28C easily from May to October. It would be well worth doing. The pool area also needs to either have a small bar area, or menus with drink and snack prices. The staff by the pool and spa area were helpful, but the area did not feel special enough. They had quite a few conferences when we were there, with about 100 people in suits all standing by the swimming pool area during a break chatting and have a cigarette. Overall, we had a great stay in Istanbul, we would have been happier at the same price (or a bit less) if the hotel was advertised as 4 star

Reviews.Title: “classy and a very international feel to it”
Reviews.Author: premalz
Reviews.Content: I used Marmara Hotel twice on a single trip. While going to Turkey for a 15 day cross country tour and while coming back from Turkey in the end. The hotel public areas are phenomenally well maintained. The front desk staff ladies were just perfect. The breakfast had a large variety with good quality materials and products. The staff was extremely attentive in the entire hotel and very well informed. Even my smallest requests like a phone charger adapter was met with delight and excellent options for me.

Reviews.Title: “Strategically located”
Reviews.Author: sbahour
Reviews.Content: All in all an excellent stay, albeit rooms are a bit small and Taksim Square is always in commotion mode which you hear in your room.

Reviews.Title: “impressive despite faults”
Reviews.Author: CelestialNomad
Reviews.Content: Pros: - geat location, landmark hotel - convenien for funiculair / tram to Sultanahmet - large rooms, great quality, lovely marble bathroom, lots of toiletries - lovely views even from the 3rd floor / city view - superb views of the city from teh top floor - amazingly fast lifts and lots of them Cons - very late night drilling (11pm) as part of extensive refurbishment which did affect mysleep but did not seem to bother the hotel when I complained - i was told it "was just the way" - horreendously pricey minibar with a kitkat like chocolate costing c Â£7 and a tea in the top floor cafe setting me back Â£10!!!!!! - no water i the taps one night - no apology, just a shrugging of shoulders! Nonetheless a great hotel and woudl happily stay again if i got the same amazing rate

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel & its location - best place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ymas2010
Reviews.Content: The best place to stay in Istanbul is close to Taksim as its always vibrant and busy. The Marmara is right on the beginning of taksim and has a metro station and bus stops across the street. The service was very good at the hotel and we were generally happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 5 stars Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elmadanat1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for 2 nights in March 2011 as i was attening a medical meeting , i think that the best thing regarding this hotel is it's location in the heart of Taksim area , close to main attractions , near istiklal avenu. Apart from this nothing special just a basic 5 stars hotel . The breakfast area was good with panoramic view but the buffet was very simple . I do recommend this hotel just for its location.

Reviews.Title: “A good business-type hotel at excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TRTL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends for a long weekend trip. Three guys in a room. Hotel was well-equipped, business-like, much like many 4-5 star places in big cities of the world. Service was average - but that was no different from any other place in Istanbul, where we found service culture in general to be somewhat underwhelming. At least sauna and small hamam were free, all else was rather expensive, including the breakfast and rooftop bar. Latter has great views though. Biggest plus: Great location directly on Taksim square, right at the central pedestrian/shopping area, and pub transport. Off the pedestrian area are plenty of good bars and restaurants, which gives good selection at night as well. All-in-all, a good place to stay, specifically for the business traveller and otherwise not adventurous person. If you look for a more local/original place, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappionting”
Reviews.Author: MCh11
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel was being renovated so it was scaffolded, we didn't let this put us off as being a 5 star we were sure it would be fine inside, little did we know. I have to say that the Marmara has to be the worst 5 star hotel we have ever stayed in for the amount we paid, it was extremely tired looking inside, the reception area was uninviting, as was the bar and breakfast room. The service was atrocious, slow with non English speaking waiters. On the first morning we waited 5 minutes for the lift to take us to breakfast, another 10 minutes for a table (there were 8 of us) and queued approx.15 minutes for a fried egg as there was only one chef frying. On a good note the bedrooms were spacious and clean, but our robes and flannels were taken after the first night and weren't replaced. As the hotel is in the centre of Taksim square some of the rooms are quite noisy at night from the busy street below.The men of our party enquired at concierge for a Hammam, they were told that a booking wasn't necessary, when they arrived they were fully booked. One evening we thought we'd have a drink at the hotel bar, my husband ordered a brandy sour, to his horror he was charged 54 TL (Â£21), when he complained about the price he was told that it was because they used the best brand of brandy. As a word of warning make sure that the taxis outside of the hotel have their meter switched on as we were ripped off on a number of occasions which again we pointed out to concierge. Although we had a very pleasant stay in Istanbul the hotel Marmara really let it down, it should have a 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good - Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: JadSawaya
Reviews.Content: I went to Istanbul with my wife for our first wedding anniversary in December 2010. We arrived around 2pm to the hotel and waited in the lobby approximately 3 hours for a room (while waiting we weren't offered drinks or any kind of attention). The room that was being prepared for us is on the 7th floor. While waiting we were the ones who had to follow up with the reception! Not to mention that 2 girls arrived after us and sat next to us waiting for a room as well. They were young russians. They came after us and took a room before us. One of the girls went to the receptionist (short guy with well combed hair) and they started smiling and talking until she came back with a key calling her friend to join her. After that scene, we went again to argue with the receptionist, he made us wait an additional half an hour and then gave us a corner room on the 11th floor instead of the one on the 7th floor stating that it was one of the best rooms in the hotel (Corner rooms are half size normal rooms - we know that because we saw our friends room whom we met in Istanbul by surprise). My guess is that the room on the 7th floor which was supposed to be ours was given to the russians instead. That said, the receptionist was not only a liar but rude as well. Added to all the above, we booked a 5 night stay with Marmara Taksim Hotel INCLUDING breakfast via expedia. Despite that statement clear on the vouchers, the receptionist and the manager (via phone call) insisted that breakfast was not to be offered because it wasn't showing in their system. We argued again for nothing, again waste of time and manners. We ended up paying breakfast 2 times!! (20 Euros per person = 200 Euros for the whole trip). The Marmara Taksim Hotel was lucky because the package that i booked via expedia was non-refundable or else i would have simply left the hotel and booked another one. As for breakfast (which is a bit poor), we are supposed to be present before 10am (or 11am, pardon me for not remembering exactly), but when that hour comes, they remove all the food on the buffet!! even while people are still having breakfast. We travel a lot and seeing that shocked us. We never saw that one coming. They are supposed to not let anyone come in the restaurant for breakfast and not remove the food!! were they saving food for the next day? Well no idea.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah600Beirut
Reviews.Content: Great staff, perfect location, right on Taksim square.. nice, clean rooms, very rich breakfast on the 21st floor with a panoramic view of istanbul Just make sure you book B&B because they made us pay for our breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: isa_ritha
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in Marmara Hotel. The rooms are nice designed and big. The view from the rooms and especially from the roof (with the pool) is fabulous. We had always a place by the pool to relax after a day in the city. The location is perfect, the shopping area is a few minutes away and there are also a lot of different restaurants and bars around the hotel. The receptionist were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: xclusiveDubai
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, bang in the center of it all with istiklal right across the street so there is plenty of things to do. The food within the hotel is terrible but there is a starbucks and an excellent restaurant called the kitchenette located right under the hotel so it makes up for it. The rooms are quite small but have the latest amenities so not much to complain there, although you can hear the street noise even from the 15th floor!! Overall im not sure i would stay there again, would def stay at the hilton in taksim or swisotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marmara Taksim for 2 nights. I booked a bosphorus view room on the internet and got a rate of around Euro 180/night without breakfast. Got into the hotel at around 830 PM and seems the hotel was full so they upgraded me to a corner suite. The room was quite good. There was a living area with a TV and a work desk and then a separate bedroom with a queen size bed. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The only strange thing was the the shower area was open to the bedroom. So OK if you are traveling with partner but not otherwise. The location is excellent, bang on Taksim square. It is next to Istikal street, the famous Istanbul walking street where there are more than 2000 bars and restaurants. There are lots of hotels even at the Sultanahmet area but I would choose to stay here any day. Taksim is the place to be. I had breakfast at the restaurant attached to the hotel at the street level. So I cant say much about the hotel food. The hotel has an excellent roof top bar which gives you sweeping views of Istanbul and the bosphorus. The service is also pretty good. When I was checking out someone else was checking in around 930 Am in the morning. The room was not ready and so the hotel immediately comped the person coffee. This I thought was a good touch as people remember such things. You also get complimentary wifi internet. Overall it is good value for the price you pay at Istanbul. Worth staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ankix
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent, close to the bustling Taksim square and Istiklal street. The metro is right in front of the hotel. There is a Starbucks as well as a good bar/cafÃ© called Kitchenette next door. We had a nice room on the 8th floor overlooking the Bosphorus, unfortunately it was quite foggy so we didn't get to enjoy the view. On the first night we arrived late and had dinner in the restaurant on the top floor. The service was good and the food as well. The breakfast buffet was ok but the service was not very good - or very effective depending on how you see it. Hold on to your things if you want to finish you glass of juice in peace... I visited the gym (free for hotel guests) and it was spacious and very clean. It has a nice view of Taksim square. The hamam is really good and well worth a visit if you don't want to visit one of the old hamams. Free wifi was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: JCR9
Reviews.Content: Nice accommodations & located in convenient area where you can walk to many casual restaurants. We had a nice room on the 19th floor overlooking the Square & the Bosphorus. The Bar/Lounge on the top floor had great service & small plates. However, do not waste your time or your money to eat in the restaurant across from the bar area. The food was mediocre & the service was poor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: AshishJaiswal
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to be at this wonderful hotel as we had booked in at the very last minute. The location is perfect - you are at the starting point of the ever exuberent Istiklal Street and the buzzing Taksim Square. The metro station is right in front of the hotel and all the transport options are easily available. The hotel is a delight to stay in - very comfortable rooms of more than the avearge size in Istanbul hotels. The only issue I have is that the mattress was a bit too soft. The breakfast was good enough by the European standards. The view from the rooms is great, on all 4 sides. Strongly recommended that should you wish to stay in the new Istanbul area, this is the hotel to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice view, staff slow”
Reviews.Author: DijanaZagreb
Reviews.Content: The views are just fantastic if youÂ´re high up in the tower. It offers the general amenities of a 5 star hotel, but I wasnÂ´t really impressed. Rooms are spacious and clean, though bathrooms are getting old. I was also quite surprised about the scarcity of foreign TV channels. An important plus is the free wifi - too many hotels charge for this. Excellent breakfast. There is no doubt that the Maramara Taksim is in one of the very best locations in all of the city of Istanbul, just a penny drop away from Estiqlal Avenue and right in the heart of Taksim Square- yet as a hotel, it does fall of its supposed five star standards. The concierge desk was not at all helpfull â€“ they are very slow we check out for 50 minutes!!! It is overpriced, and the Intercontinental is in as good of a location as the Marmara. Few times we had to call the reception for new towels, new shampoo, new everything- they were never changed, 2 hairdrayers doesnto work at all. The rooms thesmelves have a fantastic view, but thats when the plusses end- there really is nothing special about this hotel. For the price it charges, one would excpect something a lot better than what was recived. Locittane cosmetics!

Reviews.Title: “This review is for YOU, dear traveler”
Reviews.Author: Forgottensage
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is okay, across the board. The two spectaculars are the once-in-a-lifetime views and the enormous swimming pool. Security is tight, and with that said, I have a few warnings: Two warnings. The first, the area is INCREDIBLY grimy and crime-ridden. While waiting in the reception area, I happened to look out the windows (during daytime) when I saw two men get into an altercation, then one of them ran to his vendor cart, grabbed a pair of scissors, ran back and tried to stab the first guy. He was pulled away, the police were called, and I'll leave it at that. The second concerns the sheer amount of scammers in the area. FOUR different times, over two nights, young men approached me, friendly-wise but soon got to inviting me to go to a bar for a quick drink. DONT FALL FOR THIS. Its a scam, you get charged outrageous prices and are forced to pay them by being strong-armed to a nearby ATM. The police will side with you, if you have the guts to report it, and make them give the money back but who wants to go through this? I'd read about it in a travel book & so didn't fall for it . . . but go on the Istanbul forum to read about a guy who was fooled "I got scammed in Istanbul . . .". The hotel itself was not the problem but the area is so dodgy that I HIGHLY recommend getting a room in the old quarters or near the water or spice bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “A Standard Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgolyan
Reviews.Content: A Standard Business Hotel, that is what it is. Nothing more. The service, room, reception etc very standard very formal. Although there was nothing wrong with the room, it gave a very old and tired feeling. I stayed there for 5 nights and after seeing other areas i wished i would have stayed at the other end of Istikal Street. If you are going to Istanbul for longer i would advice you to stay in areas depending on what you want to do. Sultanhmet: For tourist attractions, palaces, mosques, cerembritis hamam, bescilica cistern, grand bazar, spice market etc. Basically you need 2 days to cover all this if you take it easy and you can do it in one day if you go fast and/or through a local tour operator. Beyoglu: For good night life, good areas to walk around in the day. You probably will be bored by the 3rd day unless you really want to just party all night in a Meykhana. Lots of small eating joints, pubs, clubs, cafes etc in this area. Taksim is one end of this wonderful lively area. (Most of the local names are spelt wrong, apologies)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: malenykij_polgar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel at least 4 times for my business stays in Istanbul. The main reason is the view. If you have the luck (and the vallet) for a room with Bosphorus view, waking up will result in sitting on the bedside for minutes, gazing at the view. Amazing, again, and again, and again. Well, the rest also fits: clean rooms, nice staff, excellent location on Taksim square, even if it gets really busy and loud during the day and until 2-3 oÂ´clock in the night. Well, this area of the city and Istanbul is not for sleeping :) Breakfast is fine, though not cheap. The other choice is to book a room without breakfast and have your first meal in any of the buffets around the hotel. The Istiglal street will offer everything you need.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Rodigungor
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel in October 2008 for a weekend and I must say I will never forget it. I had the best time ever. Me and my lover had an apartment at the 17th floor from where we could admired the istanbul by night. All the cosmetics at the bathroom are from L'Occitane. The hotel is impecable. It is very clean, staff is very friendly, the location is very good. You have all you need there. Rooms are very big and very clean. everything is perfect either for romance or business. I just read a review from a person in Istanbul saying this hotel is bad and reccommending other hotels. To be honest, I think that person is from the competition, because I can't understand how could he or she said that about this hotel. If you get Istanbul and you want to stay in a 5 stars hotel, this hotel is the best option.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are many other options in Istanbul at better prices”
Reviews.Author: donstefano
Reviews.Content: A five star hotel on Taksim square. The views are just fantastic if youÂ´re high up in the tower. It offers the general amenities of a 5 star hotel, but I wasnÂ´t really impressed. Rooms are spacious and clean, though bathrooms are getting old. I was also quite surprised about the scarcity of foreign TV channels. An important plus is the free wifi - too many hotels charge for this. Excellent breakfast. But the hotel food and drinks are outrageously expensive - 12 lira for a coffee is ridiculous. I have an expense account, but there are limits. Watching the suicidal traffic on Taksim square is fascinating, but the square is very noisy. Despite good quality windows, a lot of the noise gets through - so take airplugs. The hotel is very centrally located, and getting there by public transport is also easy. There no need to get a taxi from the airports, as the Havas shuttle bus stops across the square. Business rooms are well equipped, but facilities are expensive. Overall, a good hotel, but I felt it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Alberto32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights.Excellent rooms, Nice decor. Modern Turkish. Great views of the center of the city. Wonderful breakfast included. Near all forms of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: seem123
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for 3 nights on business trip .The location of the hotel is excellent ,one can walk up to nearby market places .Good for business stay .Rooms were small and not very modern We got a room with a bad view but the staff was courteous .If you are tourist and interested in all the historical sites then stay in the Sultanahmet area

Reviews.Title: “best view of all the city”
Reviews.Author: bestenergy
Reviews.Content: this hotel is really the best if you have a room with view also i am imprest with cleaning service and best location

Reviews.Title: “great location and view”
Reviews.Author: rebecca_vanella
Reviews.Content: i've been to the marmara the hotel is great i found it very clean and the room was great. we took a bosfor view room wich was beautiful . the staff a little bit sophisticated. and the day trips to borsah with there agent was a scam . but overall the hotel is fascinating

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business”
Reviews.Author: Taffadvisor
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for business trip. great veiws over Taksim. I would stop here every time i travel to Istanbul on Business

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Bitternwatcher
Reviews.Content: The Marmara may seem a distance from the centre of things, being located on the other side of the Golden Horn to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and other main sights, but transport links are quick and efficient (the speedy funicular which links with the tramline to Sultanhamet - just 5 stops away - is 2 mins from the hotel) and it's no bad thing to escape the throngs of tourists in the evening. The somewhat impersonal-looking hotel has superb views over the Sea of Marmara and the Bosphorus and it is worth paying the extra for a room with sea view - we didn't and regretted it as the city view is less than exciting. The room was small for a 5* hotel it was perfectly comfortable although the loo would have benefitted from half a gallon of bleach and the bath was very shallow. Sadly we didn't have time to try out the Hamman, which looked spacious and exotic and is not segregated for men and women. When we return to Istanbul we shall stay in the Marmara again (but next time in a room with a view). As a tourist accompanying a working spouse the Marmara ticked all the boxes for us.

Reviews.Title: “top place”
Reviews.Author: suzziesue15
Reviews.Content: now THE MARMARA TAKSIM SQUARE,is one of the best hotels ever,ive stayed here soo many times.i would recomend this hotel to anyone.its in the middel of city sooooooo much going on out side.across the road is metro..its such a good place ,good staff,good food,very clean swimming pool .gym bars cafes shops.the lot all in one hotel i give better then a 5*its 100%going back there end of this month..christmas is good time for new years eve they have good partys plenty of food and plenty of drink...valantines is out off this world iff you like sweet cakes :0))))) heres the photos to show... very clean rooms the whole place is just perfect love you MARMARA SEE YOU SOON X X X X X X

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Marmara Hills”
Reviews.Author: KKKrish
Reviews.Content: It was a long business trip and lot of work pressure, however the sights from the Hotel was too pacifying those work related pressures. The view of Bosporus from the hotel was marvelous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellady84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was certainly a good choice. No its not in the old town, but its a better choice for someone who wants to stay in a nice hotel that is both very elegant and a good price (150 US/night). Its off Taskim Square which was nice (my boyfriend did think the square was loud at night-but just because of people walking and cars, there weren't any nightclubs right there or anything like that). Public transportation is literally right outside the hotel (and its better than any public trans sys in the states! Really clean and cheap (about 1.25 US a ride). The hotel staff was very pleasant, the room was small but nice and clean with a new flat screen tv, the hallways were quite but a lot of people were staying at the hotel. And while it doesn't seem very important there was a good level of security (metal detectors at the entrance). Anyways a really nice choice for young or old.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jordan-DallasTX
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I stayed at Marmara for a few days during our visit in Istanbul. Since this was our first trip to Turkey, we were so happy that we have chosen Marmara. I must say the trip advisor reviews are tremendous help. This is an excellent hotel, first class professional service and amenities and the best was the great location; right in the middle of the district called TAKSIM in istanbul, which is an old historical site with great site seeing and shopping. We enjoyed hours of strolling thorugh the thousands years old cubble stone streets and little shops with so much veriety (from the most eleborate western to authentic Eastern/Turkish) And we have tried out many different places to taste the always incredible Turkish cuisine, and I don't think I have any memnory of having any complaints for anything, especially the food and the general atmosphere we had expereinced in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: traveladdict089
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location in Taksim Square. Close to some excellent restaurants and ideal for couples. Highly reccommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Center Hotel”
Reviews.Author: binxale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Taskim Square at the beginnning of Istikal Caddesi...so in the Center of Istanbul. The hotel is very nice, in Luxury style....a little busy of people... Room are fine... only problem with the breakfast, too tiny restaurant for such hotel. Gym great, with sauna and hamma ...very good for relax. Outdoor swimming pool... ok.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Istanbul and Taksim center”
Reviews.Author: alta626
Reviews.Content: Hotel seems to cater to business and the odd tour group. The amenities are first rate, the rooms smaller than expected but nicely done. The service is good and efficient, but laundry service is pricey, but presentation is excellent. The location in Taksim is excellent for dining and getting to appointed areas. We had no trouble sleeping and were not bothered by outside noises, except for the call to prayers at dawn--an exotic sound to Western hears.

Reviews.Title: “professional”
Reviews.Author: mustafaetkarim
Reviews.Content: a suitable hotel for business ravelers with friendly staff and a very logistic location in the heart of istanbul in taksim area very close to istiklal street and other busy and lively areas

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: NenaMX
Reviews.Content: I simply loved the hotel, the staff, the service, the room, the view!!!!!!!! was amazing!! the location is the best ... you'll love it too ;)

Reviews.Title: “Oh the noise, noise, noise, noise!”
Reviews.Author: KarenfromDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marmara on business and the rates were exorbinant (over 400 euros without breakfast) so my expectations were high. The Marmara is located in a vibrant, busy part of Istanbul, and if you are on the side overlooking Taksim Square it is very loud-- I was given a room on the 8th floor and had a lot of difficulty sleeping -- the traffic never really settled down and the honking was incessent. I had the good fortune to move to a room in the back of the hotel n the second night, which was comfortable but small. I was also frustrated that there were no outlets available to charge my blackberry, and as everyone nowadays travels with cell phones, ipods and so on, I was surprised that the room lacked that feature. As breakfast was not included, I went to the cafe that fronts to the hotel, and the Starbucks right next door. The cafe had great croissants and was good for people watching. In terms of location, I far prefer the Sultanamet area, which is the old city where the Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar are located, and would strongly urge tourists, in particular, to stay there, especially since traffic in Istanbul is so terrible. However, Taksim Square does have its fun side -- there is a very lively, vibrant pedestrian street just a block away with an incredible number of cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Just Great”
Reviews.Author: hodashark
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in Marmara Istanbul hotel in Taksim. We were in the 14th floor, view to Bosphorous. The View was really wonderful. The room very clean. The service just excellent. The breakfast ( lots of varieties) and really tasty. The staff of the hotel, very polite, friendly and cooperative. We enjoyed our stayed indeed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too busy, disorganised and rundown”
Reviews.Author: Oxfordeddie
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous but the hotel itself is badly run. The lifts are crowded, the breakfast area too full and unrelaxing and the rooms themselves not worthy of a five-star hotel. The swimming pool is a real bonus but it closes at 7pm. Istanbul has a huge range of hotels and this one is certainly over-rated. Make sure you shop around! The airport shuttle service is inadequate and costly.

Reviews.Title: “I never get tired of this hotel..simply the best”
Reviews.Author: maha123
Reviews.Content: It's great when u feel like you have another family in a great hotel..all the staff treat me like one of there family..amazing food and service and a great location....this hotel is my favorited in whole istanbul...i want everyone to experience it...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Marmara Taksim”
Reviews.Author: toddletrav
Reviews.Content: We stayed a long weekend at the Marmara, and had a wonderful experience. We had a suite on the 14th floor, facing the sea. The views are spectacular - requesting a high floor room is particularly important here. The living room had views of old town and the Sea of Marmara, and the bedroom views of the Bosphorus. Too bad there's so much to do and see in Istanbul, because we could have just sat in the room and looked at the view! The suites give you access to the club lounge on the 18th floor, where you can have breakfast (smaller selection than the main breakfast area, but still very good and much more serene atmosphere), or afternoon snack and drinks, again with amazing views. The price for the very spacious and well-laid out suite (2 separate rooms - a big plus with a baby) was a great value compared to international chains. Positives: The views - WOW !!! You even have a view from the shower. Location is good, many restaurants nearby, short taxi ride to most sightseeing, though it can take a while to get to Sultanahmet in traffic. The room was very nicely decorated and immaculately clean, elegant bathroom. Friendly service throughout our stay. Room service, though very pricey, arrived quickly. Breakfast was fantastic. Negatives: The pool is unheated and was a bit on the cold side, also not protected from wind, and for some reason they were blasting club music in the pool area...not to my taste for relaxation. Still it's a good sized and very clean pool. Check-in was a little slow, and we were at first given a smoking room, though they were accomodating in moving us a few hours later once a room became available. It also took a long time and repeated requests to get the baby cot sent up. As someone mentioned below, the bar prices are ridiculous. One of the elevators was out of service, and the waits could get a bit long. Still we would stay here again in a heartbeat, and loved our time in Istanbul. Great hotel, wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: ZeynepViyana
Reviews.Content: Clean, very friendly and helpful personnel (only suggestion: during peak hours they might consider placing 1 or 2 more receptionists at the front desk), excellent service in all areas of the hotel, big room (business club junior suite on the 16th floor with magnificant view over istanbul), excellent breakfast in the business lounge which also offered drinks and small canapes throughout the whole day, no other hotel exists in istanbul which is more central than the marmara, eventhough taksim is a very loud area which never sleeps - one does not hear anything of it once in the hotel, only negative point which i can mention here is: the hotel has an indoor garage if you are planning to travel by car, which costs a bit too much for a day and we were not informed about the price while checking in. Next time we are in istanbul, we will surely make sure to stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Great, but..”
Reviews.Author: Bertago
Reviews.Content: I stayed one week at Marmara Istanbul Taksim. Nothing wrong to say about it exept following: 1. My girlfriend wanted a smaller pillow, and we asked three times for this. Did it show up during our week there? Nope. 2. The cleaning of the rooms could be better. 3. The prices in the bar is not turkish, they are norwegian. 15 TL for an beer, and 30 TL for a mojito.. 4. Rooms a bit small. The photos at the website if a bit too positive:) The staff was friendly, the breakfast was delicious, the pool area was perfect. Location couldnt be better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Taksim Sq”
Reviews.Author: Recoleta
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice - spacious rooms, beautiful views of Bosphorus if you're on the correct side of the building. Breakfast had a huge assortment. Hammam treatments were booked in advance and hard to come by - too bad such a popular hotel does not offer more time slots. The location is good if you're looking to be in Taksim Sq in the new city. It turned out that we went to the old city every day of our stay. We thought taxis would be quick and cheap. They were relatively cheap but certainly not quick. Traffic was a disaster, not sure if it was just when we were there or if it is the standard in Istanbul but a supposedly 10 min ride took us up to 50 minutes (!) on several occasions. We gave up and started to use the tram which goes along the straits which was modern, convenient, w/ air con and quick.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: wwwales
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a 4 day break in Istanbul at the Marmara hotel - the hotel is in a great location - right outside is the bus station, metro and historic tram. Loads of places to eat\drink and shopping right on the doorstep. Plenty of staff on the door to help with bags etc and the internal decor is of a high standard. Good sized double bed room with flat screen tv etc. Room is very clean. If you don't have your laptop you can use the buisness centre on the 1st floor for internet access (great for on-line checkin for the airport) - the internet is free for the first 15mins although I used it for longer and still wasn't charged. Overall I'd recommend this hotel and would definately use if in Istanbul again. Booking via expedia I got a great room rate - the week after I booked the same room was twice the price so if you can be flexible on the dates your staying you may be able to get a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE! Dishonesty, theft, untrustworthy staff.”
Reviews.Author: Istanbul_9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marmara for 5 days (May 09) as part of a business school trip. The safe in my room did not work, so I put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on my door-- to keep the staff out (the safe closed, but would not lock. I was told that the hotel was booked, so my room could not be switched). 2 days later I had 2 $100 bills stolen, and when i returned to the room i knew it immediately. I contacted security and the guest relations director, (I was even able to tell them the time that the unauthorized entry took place!) and when they produced the keylog, sure enough, there had been an entry into my room by the person who stocks the mini-bar (why would he enter if the sign was on the door?). After being assured it would be resolved, the Guest Relations Manager (Dunya) will not even answer my emails. I am a medical doctor, and have traveled all over the world. Yes, I take responsibility for leaving cash in a safe that did not lock- my fault, no question. But I have never had so blatant a theft of my personal property. The $200 is not nearly as bad as knowing somebody violated my trust, found evidence supporting the theft, and then lied about-- "it will be resolved." (Incidentally, my european travel adapter was stolen as well). I would not stay in this hotel if it was FREE- DO NOT STAY HERE. The staff is discourteous, rude, and most importantly DISHONEST. I now have business in Istanbul, and will NEVER stay at the Marmara, there are many other safe, excellent hotels in the city (Swiss Hotel, Four Seasons, Best Western President, Crowne Plaza)... Gary John Mullen, MD, MBA Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Not more than 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: Armenia
Reviews.Content: Just back from staying in Marmara Istanbul for 4 nights (10-14 June). I did my reservation via Easytobook.com. The rate for 4 nights stay was EUR645 (which would be EUR162/night). While was making reservation the system showed breakfast included rate than confirmation missed that info. I have contacted hotel directly to check the rate. The hotel replied with confirmation. What was the surprise at check-in: the breakfast is not included. Fortunately, I was holding all the communication. Finally, the hotel management has considered as breakfast included on the next morning only. We arrived late at the night and were upgraded to Bosphorus view corner room on 12 floor. Once we entered to this room my first impression was that we should get out of there on the next day. In general the hotel is really outdated. The room size was one of the smallest that I had ever seen in hotels: not more 14sq/m. There is only 1 small closet in narrow walking hall. The bathroom was one the simplest and dirtiest that I ever seen in so called 4 or 5 star hotel: you may see some pictures taken in that bathroom. The breakfast was not so good: nothing special, it might be richer... We did not use other facilities in this hotel, such as restorant, pool, etc... Some positive points: 1. Good location for public transportation use, 2. Relaible wireless internet access for free and LCD TV in room, 3. really nice views for Bosphorus oriented rooms. Negative poins: 1. Overpriced, I would consoder as maximum 3 star hotel, no more. 2. Really small rooms which are outadated, not comfortable furnishing and lighting, 3. Non-clean bathrooms.. My recommendation: do not stay at this hotel if you expect 4 or 5 stars especially for the rates mentioned. It is better to choose another 4-5 star hotel at Taksim square unless you prefer really overpriced rooms with the Bosphorus views. Maximum rate that I would grant would be 2-3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but spring for the Bosphorous view”
Reviews.Author: deprosecutor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marmara for a wedding and reserved a "Deluxe City View" room. The room I was given was on the 8th floor and had two twin beds. The hotel is very conveniently located right across the street from the metro (which connects to the light rail system to all the sights in Sultanhamet) and across the square from a Havas bus stop which connects directly to the airport. The staff of the hotel is very friendly and professional. The one negative is that Taksim square is very noisy at all hours of the day and night and if you get one of the city view rooms you will be serenaded by the sounds of cab drivers honking and police at all hours of the night. If you are a light sleeper, I would strongly suggest reserving a Bosphorous-side room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views”
Reviews.Author: goodtrips01
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 18th floor (a Club Floor) with Bosphorus view Delux room. The views from the room and the Club room were amazing. Note that the Club Room where you will eat breakfast and have drinks all day and a cocktail and hors d'oeuvers time in the afternoon is also on the 18th floor so it's convenient.. The service was quite good. The lounge, however, is not so good. (just not great ambience) The rooftop pool is good and the workout area is good as well. There are plenty of places to go in town that are. We ate at Korfez on the Asian side. Take the 10 minute boat over and ask for a table by the water. It was wonderful. The Four Seasons Bosphorus has a stunning terrace where you can go for after dinner drinks in warm weather. Zuma is on the water (ask for a table near the water) and has very good food and views. 360 is a rooftop restaurant with nice outdoor seating. I wouldn't want to have to sit inside, though. (ambience isn't the best inside)

Reviews.Title: “Consider the Metropark instead of Marmara - cheaper, less noisy, nicer staff and 50m distance between the two hotels”
Reviews.Author: goingshopping
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Metropark at Taksim Square from the Marmara Hotel at Taksim Square as I was not happy. The Marmara hotel was EUR150 for a double room with breakfast and in comparison the Metropark was EUR90 for a double room with breakfast. Yes the Marmara has a nicer foyer and a pool area but the rooms are VERY cramped, VERY noisy unless you pay EUR30 extra to NOT be on Taksim Square and at breakfast the selection is more vast but wow it gets crowded. In comparison the Metropark is very clean, big rooms, relatively well decorated, free wifi, breakfast still has a good selection (mueslis, juices, scrambled eggs, fruit etc...) and the distance from the Marmara is 50metres! Taksim Square is a good location for shopping and restaurants but in general to get to main tourist sites you need to take public transport/taxis...

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Town”
Reviews.Author: Anser_M_H
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying 3 nights in The Marmara Hotel Istanbul with my family (3 girls 7, 13, 17). I had a local guide 2 of the days, so we saw a lot of IST, but we really felt like home at the Marmara and the location close to the shopping street where everything is available, is superb. When i will visit Istanbul again, i will for sure consider Marmara as my first choice, or at least a hotel located in Taksim area. We stayed in the club room on the floor, and the view from here is amazing. So all in all a nice hotel in a super super city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Louise_CD
Reviews.Content: I went a while ago as it was in November 2008 but I never got around to writing a review... The hotel is really worth recommending, though. I stayed for business and only for a few days but I must say I'd happily return on holidays. My room was not huge but extremely comfortable with fantastic views, I wish I could have brought home that view of the morning light over the water! They organized a business event for us and everything was just perfect. The location is really good as well, especially if you want to go shopping, right in Taxim square close to Istiklal street, and the hotel is known as a bit of a landmark there.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not a great deal”
Reviews.Author: gqa
Reviews.Content: the nicest thing about the Marma hotel is its location, lobby, free internet, and its views. otherwise its lacking in certain areas. i'm currently staying at this hotel and i stayed at the Istanbul Hilton for 5 days before coming here. the Marama is more expensive because of it location but the hilton is only a 10 minute walk away. the rooms in the marmara are smaller with no balconies like you get with the Hilton. you have to ask for an Iron & board were it comes standard in you room at the hilton. the 2nd one they brought me at the M was leaking. i aslo could not get them to bring me a wash cloth. i asked several times and only got 1 for the 4 days i stayed and they took it when they cleaned my room and never returned it. there is a flat screen tv in the M where as the hilton had an older regular tv. both hotels had terrible air condition. the M has an antequated phone system. and dont ask for a tailor there unless you speak Turkish because 2 of my pants were destroyed when trying to have just 1 tailored. the staff were very polite and that is a plus but for the money i would choose the Hilton. this is barley a 4 star hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: FBZ
Reviews.Content: Having previousl lived in Istanbul, and visited the Marmara many times, this was our first actual stay at the hotel. Strangely, one of the attractions, over the Easter weekend, was the price, when compared to many much lower-class hotels. We had a lovely room on the 14th floor with a great view over the city, a very comfortable good-sized bed and a nice bathroom with good shower. The hotel has one of the best locations in Istanbul, just at the top of Istiklal Caddesi and right next to the metro and the new funicular railway, which links with the tram system at Kabatas (this takes you to Sultanahmet and on to the airport). The Havas airport bus stop is just across the road. The staff were very helpful, particularly Dunya, on the guest relations desk, who made sure we were looked after. We only had breakfast on one day of our stay, and this was delicious with a good range of choices.
