If you don't want a full breakfast, there is a Starbucks just outside the hotel and several other good patisseries and cafes in close striking distance. Tips: beware the taxi drivers around Taksim Square. Much to the disgust of most of the taxi drivers, there are a few who are just out to rip you off, and staying at the big five star hotels singles you out as being a good bet. Hold on to your note until the taxi driver has produced the right change and make sure the meter is on day rate (it should show either Gunduz or '1' on the meter). They can only charge 'gece' or '2' after midnight. Nice tip: If you want a nice fish dinner without heading to the tourist traps of Nevizade or Kumpapi, head up to the Bosphorous village or Ortakoy (only about ten minutes/10 lira in a cab). There are lots of nice restaurants - Cinar is particularly good. Other good bets close to the hotel are Changa (delicious fusion menu) and Cok Cok about ten minutes walk away near the Pera Palas Hotel - a great Thai restaurant. If you are pushing the boat out, Feriye Restaurant, just before Ortakoy, has a spectacular location on the Bopshorous and delicious Ottoman food. Having tried about 40 different hotels in Istanbul over the last ten years, we will definitely be returning to the Marmara.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excellent hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: maximinious
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, the people are very nice, they were very nice with the children, the breakfast is good, the view out of the room was very pretty, the location was great the buses go there the taxis go there and the metro is there too, every thing was great.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with great views over Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: Mehau
Reviews.Content: Marmara Istanbul does not too spectacular in first approach. When I got there lobby was beautiful, rich in decorations with nice fish tank in the middle. However every time I was sitting in the lobby it was full of smoke, I have feeling that whole hotel is full of it like a giant ash tray. I know smoking is common in Turkey, but I was expecting a little bit more of no smoking policy in the International Hotel. I cannot complain about front desk staff â€“ they were always nice and professional. Room I got was facing Bosporus. Room had big window (you can find pictured with view from it in this review) and oriental style furniture. I was satisfied with it and I felt like I am in Turkey. Unfortunately prices were absolutely too high. Local Efes beer in bar was for 20$ / 0.33l !!!!! Hotel is located a little bit too far from Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and Hagia Sophia. Tax was around 40$ in one way. Hotel is great for Business. If you will stay there donâ€™t forget check sky bar with amazing view over city.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its best”
Reviews.Author: Sony1Luzern
Reviews.Content: The Marmara Hotel is an awarded 5*****Star hotel in the City Center of Istanbul. Not only 4****Star like the description on Tripadvisor. The service level and the warm welcome is as high as you expect from turkish hospitality. Beginning form the Bell Boy over the Security, Concierge to the Staff of all departments. My first stay was in a standard room which was very good, but if you have the chance to make an upgrade for the CLUB FLOOR, as I did, just do it! You'll love it. I stood on the 19th floor seaside (room 1919) with a fantastic view over the Bosporus, to the Asian side and the Maiden Tower. The seperate breakfast room on the 18th floor (only for CLUB FLOOR guests) is one of the specials I can't get enough of it. I felt like a VIP. The CLUB LOUNGE was never crowded, quiet, friendly waiters looking personaly for you and with an antastic view over the Golden Horn, the Old City of Istanbul (Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Spice Bazar, Galata Tower). The CLUB LOUNGE offers also the whole day soft and local drinks with pastries and during the happy hour (between 5 - 7p.m) fingerfood for free. Free internet (WLAN) is also available in the rooms and the lounge. I felt all the time comfortable, relaxed, my desires where fulfilled more than I expected. I recommend everyone a stay at "The Marmara Hotel" to make their own expierience. Enjoy hospitality at its best. Regards

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: zoomendoscopist
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Marmara on February. The hotel is at Taxim sq and the Bosphorus view rooms have a great great view. Rooms are nicely decorated, clean and the service is excellent. It does not have the luxury of a 5 star hotel..more of a 4 star i would say...but with a 6 star view... There is free high speed internet in the business centre, and free wifi also...The position is ok but in istanbul due to the terrible traffic u never know how much time it will take to arrive anywhere.. We had a dinner at the roof garden restaurant which has very nice views over the city and Bosphorus. Food was good as was the service.... Generally this hotel is a good choice to explore istanbul and have a really pleasant stay...

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: Bombero1979
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on business. Was very happy to recieve an upgrade to the CLub Level on the 19th floor. The room's decor was modern and functional with a Turkish twist. I found the staff extremely helpful, the bed very comfortable and and the breakfast good. The location of teh hotel, on Taksim Square, was prefect for business, and the views are stunning for tourist or traveller. The hotel also provides free Wifi internet which is always appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irma_H35
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my fiance for 3 nights and I'm very satisfyed.I can say is Excelent hotel.Perfect location.The reception is very helpful.Breakfast is excelent.Nice service.Clean place.And most important is in Taksim Square that I like so much, many many shopes around.Definitely I want to go back again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations”
Reviews.Author: MCAAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Booked into this hotel for a weeks stay with my husband and two teenage children, but only stayed one night. We were not informed that the hotel was undergoing renovations and the noise from construction was continuous from 9am until 5am.Our agent in Istanbul was excellent and moved us to the Hilton Istanbul which was fabulous. However, apart from the noise,the hotel staff were helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beautiful view and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Clausius
Reviews.Content: What an exceptional property! The rooms are all newly renovated, ours looked at the Sarayburnu-Topkapi-Golden Horn direction, Room 1502. Previously stayed at 1902 and 1402 all overlooking the same view. After renovations, the rooms and facilities are excellent, breakfast buffet and the people working there are very cordial, helpful, and accommodating. Recommend highly to anyone for pleasure or business since its location is excellent. Wish we had eaten at the top floor restaurant; just could not fit it in. NEXT TIME!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: k_odonoghue
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for shopping, restaurants etc . For business trips the location is also ideal as it is central enough not to have to spend hours in the traffic on the way to meetings. The view is magnificent and the bar inviting. Service was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Large room, high quality furniture etc. Bath slightly shabby but very clean. Great breakfast buffet. Overall excellent value for money and I would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Comprehensive review by an Events Manager”
Reviews.Author: MrBlahBlahWhatever
Reviews.Content: In February 2008, I took 350 people to this hotel on an incentive trip, in my capacity as Events Manager within a Dubai-based regional office of a multinational institution. Prior to this, I also pre-scoped the hotel in December '07. In December, I stayed in a standard room, and in Feb, I stayed in a Club room. I stayed at Marmara a total of 8 days, and inspected every room-type. Impressions: The location: CANNOT be beaten; you exit the hotel, turn left and you are a minute away from a very Bohemian-like street called Istiklal Street, which is full of great little street eateries and strolling locals and tourists - a very atmospheric place. You are also reasonably close to the main tourist attractions such as the Sultan Ahmet Mosque; the Hippodrome; Aya (Hagia) Sofia and the Palace Museum. Be warned tough, that the airport is at least 40 minutes away. Rooms: The standard room was adequate and pleasant - probably mid-way between a 3 and 4 star. It was clean, and everything worked. The decor was pleasing enough. Refer to my pics please. Club room is a better proposition. Difference is that you get a flat screen TV, and a few extra little niceties. Do yourself a favour and go for Club. The suits are really good, and are quite adequate for a CEO to stay in, as mine did. They're large, clean, and contain business amenities such as a fax machine; shredder- and the like. Whatever class of room you choose, my advice is to ask for a Bosphorus view room - the view is really worth the extra small charge. Please be warned that if you try to open the windows in the same way that one would open a door, then you're in for a night of open air, as you'll not be able to close them again: the windows do not swing open more than a couple of inches, even though they LOOK as if they swing wide open. Try to yank the window way open, and you'll have a problem. In addition, when you enter your room, check that the a/c is working, as they apparently switch off the chiller at a certain time of year, and you'll just have the a/c fan working. They cannot switch the chiller back on in a hurry either, as it involves some long-winded procedure to be undertaken by the hotel engineer. Bathrooms had marble-top counters; modern amenities in good repair, and were clean. (See my pics). Corridors were painted in a curious bright blue colour that throws out the otherwise nice decor. They need to reconsider this scheme. It struck me as being too "loud" and an eyesore. The lobby is nice and atmospheric- it has a regal look about it, and the decor is Turkish. Lighting is nice and relaxing. Lounge is good, and the bar service good too. The hotel contains a pleasant bar -the Tepe Lounge- that overlooks the city lights - I do not recall which floor it is on, but it has a "Manhattan cocktail lounge" feel to it - intimate and relaxing. Breakfast buffet is quite ok. Clean restaurant. Food quality fine, but leave the tastless rubber chicken franks alone. Not sure about dinner, as I had roomservice burgers and my dutyfree Jack D. for dessert every night, due to being too busy ;-) Room service food quality is good, and portions pretty big. Average wait time is about 20 to 30 minutes. Reception staff are agile; pleasant and professional. The hotel also has a spa, and although I did not use it, it looked clean and professional, and reports that came back to me were positive. Conference / congress facilities: good conference room. Easily fits 350 pax in cabaret style setup. Projectors and sound good. Modern amenities. Service ethic overall: no complaints. Staff seemed interested; friendly; professional and reasonably prompt. In my subjective view, I like Marmara because its has character, and is atmospheric. I chose it, as I wanted my delegates to have a more "Turkish" experience, as opposed to booking them into another "photocopy" standard Western-style hotel, to which them and I are all accustomed to. I would like to stay at Marmara again. I rate it overall, as around a four star, but not a "4-plus"; probably a "4-minus". However, the character makes up for it, I reckon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Spot In The City!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGal62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in early August. The service and food were incredible. Loved the location. My room had all of the amenities I could ask for and the free wireless internet worked great! I would highly recommend this property to anyone visiting Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and veiw but it is busy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abedelhadi
Reviews.Content: Actually I stayed in Marmara hotel for 5 days, the receptions are not bad but I wait more than 20 minutes waiting until my room gets ready. The hotel view is great, I took besphour view but next time if I returned back to this hotel I will take a golden horn view. see pictures the location is great every thing around you. also the breakfast is wonderful and rich. one of the disadvantages. that this hotel is really busy if you set in the lobby you will feel you are in the mall. sometimes in the breakfast the restaurant is so busy. but the service are fast and can speak English and this is great advantage in city like Istanbul

HotelInfo.Name: The Marmara Taksim
HotelInfo.Address: Taksim Meydani Taksim, Istanbul 34437 , Turkey
